name: dbt-agent-skills
description: Skills for working with dbt Core and the dbt Fusion engine - analytics engineering, data modeling, semantic layer, and dbt platform (fka dbt Cloud) operations

plugins.name: adding-dbt-unit-test
plugins.description: Use when adding unit tests for a dbt model or practicing test-driven development (TDD) in dbt

plugins.name: answering-natural-language-questions-with-dbt
plugins.description: Use when a user asks a business question that requires querying data (e.g., "What were total sales last quarter?"). NOT for validating, testing, or building dbt models during development.

plugins.name: building-dbt-semantic-layer
plugins.description: Use when creating or modifying dbt Semantic Layer components including semantic models, metrics, and dimensions leveraging MetricFlow.

plugins.name: configuring-dbt-mcp-server
plugins.description: Use when setting up, configuring, or troubleshooting the dbt MCP server for AI tools like Claude Desktop, Claude Code, Cursor, or VS Code.

plugins.name: fetching-dbt-docs
plugins.description: Use when fetching dbt documentation, looking up dbt features, or answering questions about dbt Cloud, dbt Core, or the dbt Semantic Layer

plugins.name: migrating-dbt-core-to-fusion
plugins.description: Use when migrating a dbt project from dbt Core to run on the Fusion engine.

plugins.name: troubleshooting-dbt-job-errors
plugins.description: Use when a dbt Cloud/platform job fails and you need to diagnose the root cause, especially when error messages are unclear or when intermittent failures occur. Do not use for local dbt development errors.

plugins.name: using-dbt-for-analytics-engineering
plugins.description: Use when doing any dbt work - building or modifying models, debugging errors, exploring unfamiliar data sources, writing tests, or evaluating impact of changes. Use for analytics pipelines, data transformations, and data modeling.
